intro: Helicteres semiglabra, commonly known as the velvetleaf or smoothleaf helicteres, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its palmately compound leaves with a velvety texture. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in subtropical regions.
